title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Adani Energy Solutions to raise at least $500 mn foreign-currency debt to fund transmission expansion
Adani to invest ₹63,000 crore in Assam power projects
items.summary:
- The Adani Group will invest about **₹63,000 crore** in Assam: **₹48,000 crore** for a 3,200 MW thermal plant and **₹15,000 crore** for two pumped-storage plants (2,700 MW), creating ~**30,000** construction jobs.
- The 3,200 MW plant will use the DBFO model with coal linkage under SHAKTI; commissioning begins Dec 2030 at **₹6.30/kWh**.
- Pumped-storage projects will aid grid stability and renewables integration, boosting Assam’s energy security and planning, with AERC approval and a future PPA with APDCL.

items.title: Shree Refrigerations: H1 net profit falls 81%
items.summary:
- *Shree Refrigerations posts an 81% YoY drop in H1 net profit to ₹1.57 crore,* while revenue remains *largely flat* at about ₹50.39 crore (consolidated) and ₹50.72 crore total.
- *EBITDA for Apr-Sep fell to ₹0.56 crore from ₹1.54 crore year-ago,* with consolidated revenue from operations at ₹50.39 crore, down ~1.1% YoY.
- *Chairman & MD Ravalnath Shende cites HVAC expansion and higher manpower costs as strategic investments expected to drive long-term growth,* as projects progress and revenues recognise.

Silmax opens facility in Bengaluru to boost expansion
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Silmax opens a new manufacturing facility in *Devanahalli*, Bengaluru, with a 10,000 sq ft footprint to bolster its capacity for milling and drilling tools.\n- The plant currently has 5,000 sq ft operational and a monthly output of *4,000–5,000 cutting tools*, improving response times in India and the Asia-Pacific.\n- The company targets *₹100 crore* revenue and plans a training program in *2026* to develop young engineers into toolmakers.

items.title: Voltas Q2 profit drops 76% to ₹32 crore on muted demand
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Voltas's quarterly *PAT* fell 76% YoY to ₹32 crore in Q2 FY26, from ₹133 crore a year earlier.
- Consolidated revenue declined 11% YoY to ₹2,412 crore, with the cooling products segment down 23% to ₹1,215 crore and swinging to a ₹46 crore loss.
- The EMPS segment grew, with revenue up 10% to ₹966 crore and profit up to ₹92 crore, aided by steady execution in projects and anticipated demand pickup after GST changes.

items.title: Trump wants skilled overseas workers to 'train Americans' then 'go back home': US Treasury Secretary
Industry urges retention of quality control norms to boost local manufacturing
Anti-dumping duty to limit unfair imports: Tata Steel CEO
items.summary:
- Tata Steel CEO T V Narendran welcomed India's anti-dumping duty on Vietnamese steel as a *positive development* to curb unfair imports.
- He said he is *not against imports* if shipments are **fairly priced** and noted Vietnam and other countries are used as transit points to move material into India.
- Narendran stressed that India's long‑term investments in capacity and efficiency underlie the policy, with the duty of about **USD 121.55 per tonne** on hot‑rolled flat steel for five years shielding domestic producers.

items.title: Decoding the manufacturing revolution in the Indian vertical mobility industry
INOX to supply nitrogen for Grew Energy solar plant in MP
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- INOX Air Products and Grew Energy signed a long-term agreement to supply *ultra-high-purity nitrogen* for a 3 GW solar photovoltaic cell plant in *Narmadapuram*, Madhya Pradesh.
- INOXAP will build a supply pipeline from its Air Separation Unit in Narmadapuram, with operations expected in early 2026.
- The deal supports India’s clean-energy manufacturing and government aims like *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat* through reliable gas supply.

items.title: Construction equipment industry expected to post 2–4 per cent growth: Crisil Ratings
AXISCADES Technologies posts 89% jump in Q2 profit at ₹23 crore
India best placed to host electronics manufacturing mega hubs, says Syrma SGS CEO Satendra Singh
DPIIT: 13 PLI filings for white goods ₹1,914 cr
items.summary:
- **DPIIT** received 13 applications with ₹1,914 crore commitment under the **PLI** for **White Goods**; window: 15 Sept–10 Nov 2025.
- Among them, 1 existing **PLI beneficiary** adds ₹15 crore; 9 aim to make **AC components** worth ₹1,816 crore; 4 plan ₹98 crore for **LED components**.
- Total **PLI White Goods** now ₹10,335 crore from 80 beneficiaries; projected production ₹1.72 lakh crore; ~60,000 direct jobs; domestic value addition to rise to 75–80%.

items.title: Cabinet okays ₹45,000 crore package to support exports, MSMEs amid global headwinds
AP-Tillman pact for Vizag data centre
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- AP government and *Tillman Global Holdings* signed an MoU to build a **300 MW** hyperscale data centre campus in Visakhapatnam with about **₹15,000 crore** investment.
- The 40-acre project is expected to create **200-300 direct** and **800-1,000 indirect** jobs by 2028, boosting digital infrastructure, logistics, cloud networks and allied services.
- Tillman will supply investment, technology and equipment; land allotments and incentives will be managed by state departments.

items.title: India's power grid struggles to absorb soaring solar supply
items.summary:
- The grid is struggling to absorb a rapid surge in solar installations, causing increased curtailment and underscoring the urgent need for *large-scale energy storage* and better grid integration.
- Solar curtailment rose to about *12%* in October, with some days denying as much as *40%* of output, while coal plants remain online to meet sunset demand.
- The trend is worsened by wind curtailment and about *44 GW* of renewables awaiting PPAs, highlighting the push for grid modernization and dispatchable storage.

items.title: NTPC plans 5-10 mt coal-to-synthetic natural gas facility
items.summary:
- NTPC plans to set up a 5-10 million tonnes per year **coal-to-synthetic natural gas (SNG)** facility and will appoint a technical consultant in the current financial year.
- The project would convert high-ash coal from NTPC's captive mines into SNG, usable for power generation or chemicals, with estimated production costs of **$10-12/mmbtu**.
- Beyond this project, NTPC targets **149 GW** of power capacity by FY32 and is pursuing nuclear energy expansion toward **30 GW by 2047**.

items.title: Tata Steel says monitoring EU, UK policy developments to prioritise, optimise decarbonisation capex
Microsoft expands Danish quantum facility with second lab
items.summary:
- Microsoft expands its *Lyngby* quantum facility outside Copenhagen by adding a second lab, making it the largest quantum site globally.
- The upgrade will support the *Majorana 1 chip* and reinforce transatlantic collaboration between Denmark and Europe, accelerating quantum research.
- Microsoft says its total quantum investments in Denmark exceed *1 billion Danish crowns*, signaling a long-term commitment to commercializing quantum tech in Europe.

items.title: Synopsys to cut about 10% of its workforce
items.summary:
- **Synopsys** plans to lay off about 2,000 employees, roughly 10% of its workforce, to redirect investments toward growth opportunities.
- It completed the $35 billion **Ansys** acquisition and reported weaker Q3 results, leading to pre-tax charges of **$300–$350 million**.
- The charges will mainly cover severance, one-time termination benefits, and costs related to site closures.

items.title: IBM says 'Loon' chip shows path to useful quantum computers by 2029
Four hydrogen valleys coming up across India to demonstrate complete green hydrogen value chain
NTPC ramps up nuclear push, eyes 16 states
items.author: Saurav Anand, ETEnergyWorld
items.summary:
- NTPC is in talks with *16 states* to acquire land for nuclear plants, aiming to add **30 GW** by **2047** as part of the **100 GW** target.
- It will develop **PHWRs** of **700–1,600 MW**, with standalone for smaller sizes and possible foreign collaborations for the 1,600 MW units.
- The push underpins a non-fossil base-load to back a **500 GW renewables** target by **2030**, with costs of roughly ₹15–₹20k crore per GW and total capex around ₹4.5–₹6 lakh crore, including the Mahi Banswara project with NPCIL.

items.title: Collins Aerospace opens new 26-acre facility in Bengaluru
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The Collins India Operations Centre (CIOC) at KIADB Aerospace Park, Devanahalli, Bengaluru, on a *26-acre* site with **₹880 crore** investment, is Collins' largest manufacturing facility in India and will create over *2,000 jobs*.
- The facility spans *1.25 lakh sq ft* and uses *Industry 4.0* systems, **AI**, additive manufacturing, and robotics; by 2026 it will host *2,200+ employees* and produce seats, lighting, cargo systems, sensors, navigation systems, water solutions, and evacuation slides.
- RTX's *Collins Aerospace* reinforces its Karnataka commitment, bolstering India's aerospace hub status; Collins already employs *6,500+* in India and recently announced an Engineering Development and Test Centre in Bengaluru.

items.title: Tata Steel Q2 net profit up 4x to ₹3,183 cr on India ops
items.summary:
- Tata Steel's consolidated net profit rose to **₹3,183.09 crore**, more than four times the prior year's **₹758.84 crore**, led by strong *India operations*. 
- Total income rose to **₹59,052.84 crore**, up over 8% YoY, with India revenue around **₹38,592 crore** (incl. NINL). 
- Net debt declined to **₹87,040 crore**, quarterly capex at **₹3,250 crore** and UK debt down by **£540 million**, amid ongoing decarbonisation and portfolio moves.
